mods.abstract: Pre-Columbian ceramic piece that resembles a whistle with a broken mouth piece. Some sculpted and incised details but not much can be made out. Consists of one large cavity with adjacent narrow opening into the mouth piece. Also, there is a small hole not connected with any other on the underside running the width of the piece.
Breakage at the stem and rough wear. Other cracks present as well as evidence that the stem was once glued back on but is now missing.

titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian figurines
Pre-Columbian cultural artifacts
George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
Special Collections
George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts

Metadata originally created in a locally modified version of Qualified Dublin Core using ContentDM (data dictionary available: https://dltn-technical-docs.readthedocs.io).
